urls.title: COVerAGE-DB: A global demographic database of COVID-19 cases, deaths, tests, and vaccines
urls.description: A global demographic database of COVID-19 cases, deaths, tests, and vaccines as reported by statistical agencies, standardized and in harmonized age groups. You can find the paper describing the database, published in the International Journal of Epidemiology, here: https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyab027 This project is currently in development, stay tuned for documentation. You can get preliminary output in 5 and 10-year age groups in the /Data folder. This contains columns for Cases, Deaths, and Tests (just a few populations report Tests bya ge)). More data can be found in the unharmonized input database. The team (so far), alphabetical by last name: Jos√© Manuel Aburto, Enrique Acosta, Diego Alburez-Guti√©rrez, Anna Altov√°, Ainhoa Alustiza, Ugofilippo Basellini, Simona Bignami, Kirstin Bobrow, Didier Breton, Eungang Choi, Jorge Cimentada, Gonzalo De Armas, Emanuele Del Fava, Alicia Delgado, Viorela Diaconu, Jessica Donzowa, Christian Dudel, Manal K. @d_alburez @PNASNews @andres9886 @MPIDRnews it's annoying when a paper claims something and seem like they must hv done the research all across the world but actually it's only in the US

@d_alburez @PNASNews @andres9886 @MPIDRnews Americans tend to regard their findings as universal even when their study targets just a sample of 20 persons in a small city. #rstats #pophealth @MPIDRnews @OxfordDemSci @CPop_SDU @CamUniCampop @estpop https://t.co/WxF93EnDAa

urls.title: Bounce backs amid continued losses: Life expectancy changes since COVID-19
urls.description: Background The COVID-19 pandemic triggered an unprecedented rise in mortality that translated into life expectancy losses around the world, with only a few exceptions. In 2021, life expectancy trends globally diverged more due to the unequal impact of the pandemic across countries, variation in the age-patterns of mortality, and differences in vaccination. We estimate life expectancy changes in 29 countries since 2020, attribute them to mortality changes by age group, and compare them to historic life expectancy shocks. Data Total death counts by age and sex came from the Short-term Mortality Fluctuations and Human Mortality databases. Registered COVID-19 deaths and vaccination counts by age and sex were sourced from the COVerAGE-DB database. Midyear population counts were extracted from the UN World Population Prospects database. Methods Life expectancy for females, males, and the total population were calculated for 29 countries for 2020 and 2021. Additionally, we calculated life exp

tweets.text: The century long trend of global increases in life expectancy has often been disrupted. COVID-19 caused the latest disruption. Great graphic by Cambridge demographer Dr. Hannaliis Jaadla with whom I'm lucky to collaborate. Upcoming work with @MPIDRnews @OxfordDemSci @CPop_SDU https://t.co/ACMpP6Wx01

@jschoeley @MPIDRnews @OxfordDemSci @CPop_SDU @CamUniCampop @estpop Very interesting. Should we say "Reported COVID-19" instead of "COVID-19". That would leave open the possibility of having undiagnosed C19 deaths hidden in the "Other" category.

The United States are the only country among 29 analyzed, where life expectancy losses since 2019 are primarily the result of increasing mortality among those younger than 60.
https://t.co/ACdB2YV4VK
#rstats #pophealth @MPIDRnews @OxfordDemSci @CPop_SDU @CamUniCampop @estpop https://t.co/OODJfZLAFL

urls.title: MPIDR - Digital and Computational Demography
urls.description: The global spread of Internet, social media, and digital technologies is radically transforming the way we live and communicate, is creating new challenges and opportunities for our societies, and is enabling social scientists to address longstanding demographic research questions in new ways.

tweets.text:
PhD Candidate @mallika_snyder from @BPC_UCBerkeley presents the first estimates of the temporal extent of COVID-19-associated demographic memory for bereaved relatives in multiple European countries.
Register now and join her talk on March, 1st! https://t.co/gaZj8GEcUd https://t.co/yEkUu0ANJI
